One of Wasco's major economic activities is agriculture
column2: specifically the growing of roses. Fifty-five percent of all roses grown in the United States are grown in or around Wasco.In addition to agriculture
column3: oil and gas extraction is a significant part of the local economy. The large Semitropic Oil Field is along State Route 46 about 7 miles (11 km) west of town. Formerly a gas field
column4: the region now mainly produces oil. Vintage Production
column6: is the primary operator as of 2010.

The Wasco Reserve are a professional baseball team competing in the independent Pecos League which is not affiliated with Major League Baseball or Minor League Baseball.  Their home games are played at Wasco Athletic Park.
